p:
Structural studies have shown that the specific targets for factor H include the α2–3 linked sialic acid glycans of the GD3 ganglioside.
38 Thus, on surfaces, where the complement component C3b has become accidentally bound, the neighboring sialic acids provide the additional affinity to bind the complement inhibitory factor H instead of the activation promoting factor B, which does not bind to sialic acids.
36
